name: Aldabra Giant Tortoise
description: The largest living land tortoise, it has a domed carapace and columnar legs typical of terrestrial tortoises. It differs from the Galápagos tortoise by head shape and a small shield at the carapace’s front edge.
food_note: Fruits, herbs, leaves, stems, occasionally invertebrates and carrion
image_alt: Aldabra Giant Tortoise, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
attractions: Lives in groups, active during the day with peaks in the morning and evening. It loves bathing and absorbs dew with extendable nostrils during dry periods.
projects_note: The only surviving giant land tortoise species in the western Indian Ocean islands, listed as vulnerable on the IUCN Red List.
breeding: We’ve kept them since 1973, starting with a young male, Aldo, from a circus.
